Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Selective Dorsal Rhizotomy and Physical Therapy in Children with Cerebral Palsy

Trial_Design.evidence: In this randomised controlled trial, 68 children with CP were randomised

Intervention.evidence: children with CP undergoing selective dorsal rhizotomy (SDR) followed by intensive physical therapy (PT) versus PT alone

Objective.evidence: This study aimed to compare impairment and functional outcomes in children with cerebral palsy

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the change in Gross Motor Abilities Estimate score from baseline to 20 months post-intervention

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was conducted using a computer-generated sequence, and allocation was concealed using sealed envelopes

Blinding.evidence: Outcome assessors were blinded to group allocation

Number_Randomised.evidence: A total of 34 children were randomised to each group

Number_Analysed.evidence: Analysis was conducted on all participants using an intention-to-treat approach

Result_Outcome.evidence: The SDR-PT group showed a significantly greater improvement in Gross Motor Abilities Estimate score compared to the PT-only group (mean difference = X, 95% CI Y to Z; p < 0.05)

Harms.evidence: No serious adverse events were reported in either group
